hero.title: Rosary: A Dance-Crazy Nurse Who Left Retirement to Fight the Pandemic | Cause of Life - NYT Opinion
hero.description: Rosary Castro-Olega was a retired nurse who returned to the frontlines to fight the virus, ultimately becoming one of the Filipino-American nurses who were disproportionately killed by the virus.

primary.lead: Christmas in the time of COVID-19
primary.title: A Christmas like no other
primary.description: "We isolate now, so that when we gather again, no one is missing."

secondary.title: 'Tis The Season To Celebrate. Here's How To Do It Safely
secondary.description: Many favorite holiday traditions could be treacherous this year because of the coronavirus. Here's how experts view the risks — and some creative, safer alternatives to keep up a festive mood.

secondary.title: Nograles: Christmas get-togethers limited to 10 people in GCQ areas
secondary.description: Cabinet Secretary Karlo Nograles reminded those living in areas under the general community quarantine (GCQ) that mass gatherings are still prohibited, thus, Christmas events like parties and family get-togethers will still be limited to 10 people.

secondary.title: Filipinos go the whole hog at Christmas. But coronavirus is crimping a yuletide tradition.
secondary.description: Pandemic hardships put a brake on festive feasts in one of the world’s most Christian countries.

carousel.title: Filipino Nurses: New York's Frontliners | 101 East
carousel.description: A look at how Filipinos are exposed everyday from the virus thru lives of New York nurses

carousel.title: 'My second life': California nurse walks out of hospital after 8-month COVID-19 ordeal
carousel.description: Merlin Pambuan's recovery after several months battling COVID-19 teaches us about hope and the fight to live.

carousel.title: ‘They’re taking him for a ride’: Has Philippines gained from Duterte’s China pivot?
carousel.description: 4 years from 2016 and the country still waits for Chinese projects and investments to materialize.
